intro: Centrosolenia orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco centrosolenia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red and purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
